verses.verse: And Jehovah<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, Go<WH935> in unto Pharaoh<WH6547>: for I have hardened<WH3513> his heart<WH3820>, and the heart<WH3820> of his servants<WH5650>, that I may show<WH7896> these my signs<WH226> in the midst of them<WH7130>,

and that thou mayest tell<WH5608> in the ears<WH241> of thy son<WH1121>, and of thy son<WH1121>'s son<WH1121>, what things I have wrought<WH5953> upon Egypt<WH4714>, and my signs<WH226> which I have done<WH7760> among them<WH3045>; that ye may know that I am Jehovah<WH3068>.

And Moses<WH4872> and Aaron<WH175> went in<WH935> unto Pharaoh<WH6547>, and said<WH559> unto him<WH559>, Thus saith Jehovah<WH3068>, the God<WH430> of the Hebrews<WH5680>, How long<WH4970> wilt thou refuse<WH3985> to humble<WH6031> thyself before<WH6440> me<WH5971>? let my people go<WH7971>, that they may serve me<WH5647>.
Else <WH3588>, if thou refuse<WH3986> to let my people<WH5971> go<WH7971>, behold<WH4279>, to-morrow will I bring<WH935> locusts<WH697> into thy border<WH1366>:

and they shall cover<WH3680> the face<WH5869> of the earth<WH776>, so that one shall not be able<WH3201> to see<WH7200> the earth<WH776>: and they shall eat<WH398> the residue<WH3499> of that which is escaped<WH6413>, which remaineth<WH7604> unto you from the hail<WH1259>, and shall eat<WH398> every tree<WH6086> which groweth<WH6779> for you out of the field<WH7704>:

and thy houses<WH1004> shall be filled<WH1004>, and the houses of all thy servants<WH5650>, and the houses<WH1004> of all the Egyptians<WH4714>; as neither thy fathers<WH1> nor thy fathers<WH1>' fathers<WH1> have seen<WH7200>, since the day<WH3117> that they were upon the earth<WH127> unto this day<WH3117>. And he turned<WH6437>, and went out<WH3318> from Pharaoh<WH6547>.

And Pharaoh<WH6547>'s servants<WH5650> said<WH559> unto him<WH4170>, How long shall this man be a snare unto us<WH582>? let the men go<WH7971>, that they may serve<WH5647> Jehovah<WH3068> their God<WH430>: knowest<WH3045> thou not yet<WH2962> that Egypt<WH4714> is destroyed<WH6>?

And Moses<WH4872> and Aaron<WH175> were brought again<WH7725> unto Pharaoh<WH6547>: and he said<WH559> unto them<WH3212>, Go, serve<WH5647> Jehovah<WH3068> your God<WH430>; but who are they that shall go<WH1980>?

And Moses<WH4872> said<WH559>, We will go<WH3212> with our young<WH5288> and with our old<WH2205>; with our sons<WH1121> and with our daughters<WH1323>, with our flocks<WH6629> and with our herds<WH1241> will we go<WH3212>; for we must hold a feast<WH2282> unto Jehovah<WH3068>.
And he said<WH559> unto them<WH3068>, So be Jehovah with you<WH7971>, as I will let you go, and your little ones<WH2945>: look<WH7200> to it<WH7451>; for evil is before you<WH6440>.
Not so<WH3212>: go now ye that are men<WH1397>, and serve<WH5647> Jehovah<WH3068>; for that is what ye desire<WH1245>. And they were driven out<WH1644> from Pharaoh<WH6547>'s presence<WH6440>.

And Jehovah<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, Stretch out<WH5186> thy hand<WH3027> over the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> for the locusts<WH697>, that they may come up<WH5927> upon the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>, and eat<WH398> every herb<WH6212> of the land<WH776>, even all that the hail<WH1259> hath left<WH7604>.

And Moses<WH4872> stretched forth<WH5186> his rod<WH4294> over the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>, and Jehovah<WH3068> brought<WH5090> an east<WH6921> wind<WH7307> upon the land<WH776> all that day<WH3117>, and all the night<WH3915>; and when it was morning<WH1242>, the east<WH6921> wind<WH7307> brought<WH5375> the locusts<WH697>.

And the locusts<WH697> went up<WH5927> over all the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>, and rested<WH5117> in all the borders<WH1366> of Egypt<WH4714>; very<WH3966> grievous<WH3515> were they<WH6440>; before them there were no such<WH3651> locusts<WH697> as they<WH310>, neither after them shall be such.

For they covered<WH3680> the face<WH5869> of the whole earth<WH776>, so that the land<WH776> was darkened<WH2821>; and they did eat<WH398> every herb<WH6212> of the land<WH776>, and all the fruit<WH6529> of the trees<WH6086> which the hail<WH1259> had left<WH3498>: and there remained<WH3498> not any green thing<WH3418>, either tree<WH6086> or herb<WH6212> of the field<WH7704>, through all the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>.
Then Pharaoh<WH6547> called<WH7121> for Moses<WH4872> and Aaron<WH175> in haste<WH4116>; and he said<WH559>, I have sinned<WH2398> against Jehovah<WH3068> your God<WH430>, and against you.
Now therefore forgive<WH5375>, I pray thee<WH2403>, my sin only this once<WH6471>, and entreat<WH6279> Jehovah<WH3068> your God<WH430>, that he may take away<WH5493> from me this death only<WH4194>.
And he went out<WH3318> from Pharaoh<WH6547>, and entreated<WH6279> Jehovah<WH3068>.

And Jehovah<WH3068> turned<WH2015> an exceeding<WH3966> strong<WH2389> west<WH3220> wind<WH7307>, which took up<WH5375> the locusts<WH697>, and drove<WH8628> them into the Red<WH5488> Sea<WH3220>; there remained<WH7604> not one<WH259> locust<WH697> in all the border<WH1366> of Egypt<WH4714>.
But Jehovah<WH3068> hardened<WH2388> Pharaoh<WH6547>'s heart<WH3820>, and he did not let the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> go<WH7971>.

And Jehovah<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, Stretch out<WH5186> thy hand<WH3027> toward heaven<WH8064>, that there may be darkness<WH2822> over the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>, even darkness<WH2822> which may be felt<WH4959>.
And Moses<WH4872> stretched forth<WH5186> his hand<WH3027> toward heaven<WH8064>; and there was a thick<WH653> darkness<WH2822> in all the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> three<WH7969> days<WH3117>;

they saw<WH7200> not one<WH376> another<WH251>, neither rose<WH6965> any<WH376> one from his place for three<WH7969> days<WH3117>: but all the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> had light<WH216> in their dwellings<WH4186>.

And Pharaoh<WH6547> called<WH7121> unto Moses<WH4872>, and said<WH559>, Go<WH3212> ye<WH5647>, serve Jehovah<WH3068>; only let your flocks<WH6629> and your herds<WH1241> be stayed<WH3322>: let your little ones<WH2945> also go with you<WH3212>.
And Moses<WH4872> said<WH559>, Thou must also give<WH5414> into our hand<WH3027> sacrifices<WH6213> and burnt-offerings<WH5930>, that we may sacrifice<WH6213> unto Jehovah<WH3068> our God<WH430>.

Our cattle<WH4735> also shall go<WH3212> with us<WH6541>; there shall not a hoof be left behind<WH7604>; for thereof must we take<WH3947> to serve<WH5647> Jehovah<WH3068> our God<WH430>; and we know<WH3045> not with what we must serve<WH5647> Jehovah<WH3068>, until we come thither<WH935>.
But Jehovah<WH3068> hardened<WH2388> Pharaoh<WH6547>'s heart<WH3820>, and he would<WH14> not let them go<WH7971>.

And Pharaoh<WH6547> said<WH559> unto him<WH3212>, Get thee from me<WH8104>, take heed to thyself<WH7200>, see my face<WH6440> no more<WH3254>; for in the day<WH3117> thou seest<WH7200> my face<WH6440> thou shalt die<WH4191>.
And Moses<WH4872> said<WH559>, Thou hast spoken<WH1696> well<WH3651>; I will see<WH7200> thy face<WH6440> again no more<WH3254>.
